[[Nashville]] |July 1 |President Obama delivered a speech on health care at Taylor Stratton Elementary School.{{cite news|author1=Emily Kubis|title=Obama talks health care in Madison|url=https://www.nashvillepost.com/news/2015/7/1/obama_talks_health_care_in_madison|accessdate=2 July 2015|publisher=[[Nashville Post]]|date=July 1, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Wisconsin}} ''[[Wisconsin]]'' |[[La Crosse, Wisconsin|La Crosse]] |July 2 |President Obama delivered a speech on the economy at [[University of Wisconsin–La Crosse]].{{cite news|author1=Bill Glauber|title=Obama pushes economic agenda in La Crosse, chides Republicans|url=http://www.jsonline.com/news/statepolitics/drama-expected-as-obama-visits-la-crosse-and-greeted-by-scott-walker-b99531109z1-311464001.html|accessdate=3 July 2015|publisher=[[Milwaukee Journal Sentinel]]|date=July 2, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Pennsylvania}} ''[[Pennsylvania]]'' |[[Philadelphia]] |July 14 |President Obama delivered remarks on [[criminal justice reform]]s at the 106th [[National Association for the Advancement of Colored People|NAACP]] Convention.{{cite news|last1=Rhodan|first1=Maya|title=Obama Calls for Sweeping Criminal Justice Reforms in NAACP Speech|url=http://time.com/3958093/barack-obama-criminal-justice-reforms-naacp/|accessdate=July 14, 2015|publisher=''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]''|date=July 14, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Oklahoma}} ''[[Oklahoma]]'' |[[Durant, Oklahoma|Durant]],
[[El Reno, Oklahoma|El Reno]] |July 15–16 |In Durant, President Obama delivered remarks on the economy at the headquarters of the [[Choctaw Nation of Oklahoma|Choctaw Nation]]. In El Reno, President Obama visited the [[Federal Correctional Institution, El Reno|Federal Correctional Institution]], becoming the first sitting U.S. President to visit a [[federal prison]].{{cite news|last1=Casteel|first1=Chris|title=President Obama heading to Oklahoma next week|url=http://newsok.com/president-obama-heading-to-oklahoma-next-week/article/5432912|accessdate=July 11, 2015|publisher=''[[The Oklahoman]]''|date=July 10, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Eilperin|first1=Juliet|last2=Horwitz|first2=Sari|title=Obama to visit federal prison in Oklahoma on Thursday|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/post-politics/wp/2015/07/10/obama-to-visit-federal-prison-in-oklahoma-on-thursday/|accessdate=July 11, 2015|publisher=''[[The Washington Post]]''|date=July 10, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|New York}} ''[[New York (state)|New York]]'' |[[New York City]] |July 17–18 |President Obama attended a [[Democratic National Committee]] fundraiser.{{cite news|last1=Jordan|first1=Fabian|title=Obama taking weekend trip to New York City|url=http://thehill.com/homenews/administration/248286-obama-taking-weekend-trip-to-new-york-city|accessdate=July 18, 2015|publisher=''[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]]''|date=July 16, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Pennsylvania}} ''[[Pennsylvania]]'' |[[Pittsburgh]] |July 21 |President Obama addressed the 116th Veterans of Foreign Wars National Convention, in light of the [[2015 Chattanooga shootings]].{{cite news|last1=Holmes|first1=Kristen|last2=Diaz|first2=Daniella|title=Obama addresses Chattanooga shootings in speech to veterans|url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/07/21/politics/obama-vfw-speech-pittburgh-veterans-of-foreign-wars-national-convention/|accessdate=July 21, 2015|publisher=[[CNN]]|date=July 21, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|New York}} ''[[New York (state)|New York]]'' |[[New York City]] |July 21 |President Obama taped his third and final appearance on ''[[The Daily Show]]''. He also attended a [[Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee]] fundraiser.{{cite news|title=President Obama heading back to NYC for 'Daily Show' taping with Jon Stewart|url=http://7online.com/politics/president-obama-back-in-nyc-today-for-daily-show-taping/868818/|accessdate=July 21, 2015|publisher=[[WABC-TV]]|date=July 21, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|KEN}} [[Kenya]] |[[Nairobi]] |July 24–26 |On July 24–26, 2015, President Obama traveled to Kenya for a three-day state visit, becoming the first sitting U.S. president to visit the country. His father, [[Barack Obama, Sr.]], was a native of the Kenyan village [[Nyang'oma Kogelo]].{{cite news|last1=Honan|first1=Edith|title=Kenya to welcome Obama 'home' to a continent that feels ignored|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-kenya-usa-obama-idUSKCN0PU11120150720|accessdate=February 19, 2016|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=July 20, 2015}} President Obama arrived at the [[Jomo Kenyatta International Airport]] in the Kenyan capital [[Nairobi]] on the evening of Friday, July 24, where he was welcomed in the tarmac by [[President of Kenya|Kenyan President]] [[Uhuru Kenyatta]] and his half-sister [[Family of Barack Obama#Auma Obama|Auma]].{{cite news|title=Obama lands in Kenya to euphoric welcome|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2015/07/obama-arrives-kenya-tight-security-150724163810652.html|accessdate=February 19, 2015|work=[[Al Jazeera]]|date=July 25, 2015}} After arriving, Obama dined with other members of his [[Family of Barack Obama#Paternal relations|paternal family]] at a restaurant in his hotel.{{cite news|last1=Dovere|first1=Edward-Isaac|title=Obama meets with extended family on first night in Nairobi|url=http://www.politico.com/story/2015/07/barack-obama-family-dinner-trip-nairobi-kenya-120591.html|accessdate=July 25, 2015|publisher=[[Politico]]|date=July 24, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Mason|first1=Jeff|title=Obama dines with Kenyan family after arriving in father's homeland|url=http://in.reuters.com/article/obama-africa-kenya-idINKCN0PY25I20150724|accessdate=February 19, 2016|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=July 25, 2015}} On Saturday, July 25, President Obama delivered remarks at the [https://web.archive.org/web/20160219221854/http://ges2015kenya.org/ 2015 Global Entrepreneurship Summit] held at the [[United Nations Office at Nairobi]], where he urged African entrepreneurs to promote security and development while working towards economic growth in the African continent.{{cite news|last1=Smith|first1=David|last2=Mutiga|first2=Murithi|title=Obama's message of hope rings true in call for Africa to flourish|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2015/jul/25/barack-obama-message-hope-kenya-africa-speech|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=July 25, 2015}} He also visited an innovation fair organized to promote his "Power Africa" initiative of promoting [[electric power]] and [[renewable energy]] in the Sub-Saharan Africa.{{cite web|title=Remarks by the President During Visit to Power Africa Innovation Fair|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2015/07/25/remarks-president-during-visit-power-africa-innovation-fair|publisher=[[White House Office of the Press Secretary]]|accessdate=February 19, 2016|date=July 25, 2015}}{{cite news|title=Power Africa initiative on course, says Barack Obama|url=http://www.nation.co.ke/news/Power-Africa-project-is-just-a-matter-of-time-Barack-Obama/-/1056/2808200/-/sljq3cz/-/index.html|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[Daily Nation]]|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=[[Nation Media Group]]|date=July 25, 2015}} Later that day, President Obama laid a wreath and paid his respects at a memorial honoring the victims of the [[1998 United States embassy bombings|1998 U.S. embassy bombings]].{{cite news|title=Barack Obama visits the US Embassy bombing memorial in Nairobi|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/barackobama/11762770/Barack-Obama-visits-the-US-Embassy-bombing-memorial-in-Nairobi.html|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|date=July 25, 2015}} Obama then headed to the [[State House (Kenya)|State House]] for an official welcoming ceremony and a bilateral meeting with President Kenyatta, where the two presidents mainly discussed [[counter-terrorism]] with regards to dealing with [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]].{{cite news|title=Obama Meets with Kenyatta|url=http://www.voanews.com/content/obama-meets-with-kenyatta/2878139.html|accessdate=July 25, 2015|publisher=[[Voice of America]]|date=July 25, 2015}} In the evening, the President was hosted a state dinner by President Kenyatta.{{cite news|last1=Flores|first1=Reena|title=Obama shows off dance moves at Kenya state dinner|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/obama-shows-off-dance-moves-at-kenya-state-dinner/|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[CBS News]]|date=July 26, 2015}} On Sunday, July 26, President Obama delivered a speech addressing the Kenyan people at the [[Moi International Sports Centre|Safaricom Indoor Arena]]. In his speech, he urged Kenyans to eradicate [[Corruption in Kenya|corruption]], confront [[Terrorism in Kenya|terrorism]], and combat inequality, saying: "You can choose the path to progress, but it requires making some important choices... it means continuing down the path of a strong, more inclusive, more accountable and transparent democracy" to "help you extend opportunity, and educate youth, and face down threats, and embrace reconciliation."{{cite news|last1=Superville|first1=Darlene|title=Obama Closes Out Historic Visit To Kenya|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/obama-closes-out-historic-visit-to-kenya_us_55b4c834e4b0224d883281fb|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[The Huffington Post]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=July 26, 2015}}{{cite web|title=Remarks by President Obama to the Kenyan People|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2015/07/26/remarks-president-obama-kenyan-people|publisher=[[White House Office of the Press Secretary]]|accessdate=February 19, 2016|date=July 26, 2015}} Before departing Kenya, Obama met with civil society groups at [[Kenyatta University]] and toured the [[Nairobi National Park]].{{cite news|last1=Roberts|first1=Alex|title=President Obama Gives Talk At Kenyatta University!|url=http://tuko.co.ke/24236-live-updates-president-obama-make-appearance-kenyatta-university.html|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=Tuko.co.ke|date=July 26, 2015}}{{cite news|title=Obama-mania hits Kenya with US President’s ‘home coming’|url=http://citizen.co.za/429931/obama-mania-hits-kenya-with-us-presidents-home-coming/|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[The Citizen (South Africa)|The Citizen]]|agency=[[African News Agency]]|date=July 22, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|ETH}} [[Ethiopia]] |[[Addis Ababa]] |July 26–28 |President Obama became the first sitting U.S. president to travel to Ethiopia. On July 27, President Obama met with [[Prime Minister of Ethiopia|Ethiopian prime minister]] [[Hailemariam Desalegn]] at the [[National Palace (Ethiopia)|National Palace]]; talks focused on the Somali Islamist militant group [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] and other security threats, as well as on [[human rights in Ethiopia]]. Obama also held talks with Kenyan and Ugandan leaders, discussing the [[South Sudanese Civil War|South Sudan crisis]].Davis Smith and Reuters, [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/jul/27/barack-obama-first-visit-ethiopia-serving-us-president Barack Obama makes first visit to Ethiopia by serving US president], ''The Guardian'' (July 27, 2015). The following day, Obama visited the [[African Union]] headquarters (Mandela Hall) and delivered remarks there, calling upon African leaders to respect democracy and uphold human rights.[https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2015/07/28/remarks-president-obama-people-africa Remarks by President Obama to the People of Africa], [[White House Office of the Press Secretary]] (July 28, 2015). |} ==August and September== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Nevada}} ''[[Nevada]]'' |[[Las Vegas]] |August 24 |President Obama attended the National Clean Energy Summit.{{cite news|author1=Kristin Donnelly|title=President Obama Rolls the Dice in Las Vegas on Climate Change|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/president-obama-rolls-dice-las-vegas-climate-change-n414956|accessdate=24 August 2015|publisher=[[NBC News]]|date=August 24, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Louisiana}} ''[[Louisiana]]'' |[[New Orleans]] |August 27 |President Obama attended the decennial commemoration of [[Hurricane Katrina]], where he met with recovering residents and delivered remarks at a community centre at the [[Lower Ninth Ward]].{{cite news|last1=Superville|first1=Darlene|title=Obama says New Orleans is 'moving forward' after hurricane|url=http://www.kansascity.com/news/government-politics/article32513097.html|accessdate=August 27, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[The Kansas City Star]]''|date=August 27, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Alaska}} ''[[Alaska]]'' |[[Anchorage]],
[[Dillingham, Alaska|Dillingham]],
[[Kotzebue, Alaska|Kotzebue]],
[[Seward, Alaska|Seward]] |August 31 – September 3 |{{see also|Global warming in the Arctic}} President Obama traveled to Anchorage and attended the GLACIER conference, regarding the effects of [[climate change]] in the [[Arctic]].{{cite news|last1=Cama|first1=Timothy|title=Obama to highlight climate change impacts in Alaska visit|url=http://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/251040-obama-to-highlight-climate-change-impacts-in-alaska|accessdate=August 17, 2015|publisher=''[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]]''|date=August 13, 2015}} President Obama also visited the towns of Dillingham, Kotzebue and Seward.{{cite news|last1=Demer|first1=Lisa|title=FAA announces flight restrictions for Seward, Kotzebue, Dillingham during Obama visit|url=https://www.adn.com/article/20150829/faa-announces-flight-restrictions-seward-kotzebue-dillingham-during-obama-visit|accessdate=August 30, 2015|publisher=''[[Alaska Dispatch News]]''|date=August 29, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Massachusetts}} ''[[Massachusetts]]'' |[[Boston]] |September 7 |President Obama delivered a [[Labor Day]] breakfast address to the Greater Boston Labor Council at the [[Boston Park Plaza Hotel & Towers]]. The president paid tribute to Boston, the labor movement, and U.S. workers.[https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2015/09/08/remarks-president-greater-boston-labor-council-labor-day-breakfast Remarks by the President at Greater Boston Labor Council Labor Day Breakfast], [[White House Office of the Press Secretary]] (September 8, 2016).Stephanie Ebbert, [https://www.bostonglobe.com/metro/2015/09/07/labor-day-visit-obama-praises-boston-workers/xm4YFB6ZIqgiCfYLIDjMKN/story.html], ''Boston Globe'' (September 8, 2015). Before departing Boston, Obama made an unscheduled stop at the historic [[Union Oyster House]], meeting customers there. Aboard Air Force One, Obama met with Massachusetts' U.S. senators, [[Elizabeth Warren]] and [[Edward J. Markey]], along with Massachusetts U.S. Representatives [[Katherine Clark]] and [[Seth Moulton]], and New Hampshire U.S. Representative [[Ann McLane Kuster]]. |- |{{flagicon|Michigan}} ''[[Michigan]]'' |[[Warren, Michigan|Warren]] |September 9 |President Obama delivered a speech on free community colleges at the Michigan Technical Education Center. He was accompanied by [[Second Lady of the United States|Second Lady]] [[Jill Biden]].{{cite news|author1=David Jackson|title=Obama's day: A college trip to Michigan|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/theoval/2015/09/09/obama-jill-biden-warren-free-community-college-michigan-technical-education-center/71920736/|accessdate=September 10, 2015|publisher=[[USA Today]]|date=September 9, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Iowa}} ''[[Iowa]]'' |[[Des Moines, Iowa|Des Moines]] |September 14 |President Obama visited the [[North High School (Des Moines)|North High School]] with [[United States Secretary of Education|Secretary of Education]] [[Arne Duncan]] to participate in a town hall meeting, discussing college accessibility and affordability.{{cite news|last1=Bolten|first1=Kathy A.|last2=Rodgers|first2=Grant|title=In Des Moines, President Obama touts college access|url=http://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/news/education/2015/09/14/president-obama-north-high-school/72265012/|accessdate=October 6, 2015|work=[[The Des Moines Register]]|date=September 15, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|New York}} ''[[New York (state)|New York]]'' |[[New York City]] |September 27–29 |President Obama addressed the [[Sustainable Development Goals|UN Sustainable Development Summit]] and the [[Seventieth session of the United Nations General Assembly|seventieth session]] of the [[United Nations General Assembly]]. He also met with [[Russia]]n [[President of Russia|President]] [[Vladimir Putin]].{{cite news|title=President Obama makes forceful defense on New Development Goals during UN General Assembly|url=http://abc7ny.com/politics/president-obama-to-begin-3-day-visit-to-nyc-on-sunday/1004077/|accessdate=September 28, 2015|work=[[WABC-TV]]|publisher=[[American Broadcasting Company]]|date=September 28, 2015}}{{cite news|title=Obama in New York for U.N., Putin talks|url=http://www.timesunion.com/news/article/Obama-in-New-York-for-U-N-Putin-talks-6533843.php|accessdate=September 28, 2015|work=[[Times Union (Albany)|Times Union]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=September 27, 2015}} |} ==October== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Oregon}} ''[[Oregon]]'' |[[Roseburg, Oregon|Roseburg]] |October 9 |President Obama met privately with the survivors and the families of the victims of the [[Umpqua Community College shooting]].{{cite news|last1=Holmes|first1=Kristen|title=Obama in Oregon: 'Strong feelings' about preventing next shooting|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2015/10/09/politics/obama-oregon-shooting-visit/|accessdate=October 11, 2015|work=[[CNN]]|publisher=[[Time Warner]]|date=October 10, 2015}} During his visit, local [[Right to keep and bear arms in the United States|gun rights]] activists protested against further [[gun control]] laws.{{cite news|title=Protests as President Obama visits college shooting families|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-34492600|accessdate=October 11, 2015|work=[[BBC News]]|publisher=[[BBC|British Broadcasting Corporation]]|date=October 10, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|California}} ''[[California]]'' |[[San Francisco]],
[[Los Angeles]],
[[San Diego]] |October 9–11 |President Obama first arrived in San Francisco, where he attended a private round table discussion with members of the [[Democratic National Committee]] and a fundraiser at [[The Warfield]].{{cite news|last1=Edevane|first1=Gillian|title=President Obama Arrives in Bay Area After Contentious Oregon Visit|url=http://www.nbcbayarea.com/news/local/President-Obama-Arrives-in-Bay-Area-After-Contentious-Visit-in-Oregon--331754941.html|accessdate=October 11, 2015|work=[[KNTV]]|publisher=[[NBC]]|date=October 9, 2015}} The President then headed to Los Angeles to attend three fundraisers – one at the residence of director and producer [[J. J. Abrams]], another at a private performance given by [[Jamie Foxx]] in [[Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles|Pacific Palisades]], and the last hosted by interior designer [[Michael S. Smith (interior designer)|Michael S. Smith]] and [[United States Ambassador to Spain|U.S. Ambassador to Spain]] [[James Costos]].{{cite news|last1=Bellantoni|first1=Christina|title=President Obama arrives in Los Angeles for fundraising visit|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-your-guide-to-surviving-obamajam-other-saturday-traffic-nightmares-20151010-story.html|accessdate=October 11, 2015|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=October 10, 2015}} President Obama spent the remainder of his weekend in [[Rancho Santa Fe, California|Rancho Santa Fe]].{{cite news|title=Obama lands in San Diego for weekend|url=http://www.sandiegouniontribune.com/news/2015/oct/10/president-obama-rancho-santa-fe/|accessdate=October 11, 2015|work=[[San Diego Union-Tribune]]|date=October 10, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|West Virginia}} ''[[West Virginia]]'' |[[Charleston, West Virginia|Charleston]] |October 21 |President Obama attended a community discussion regarding the issue of [[substance abuse]], meeting with teachers, medical professionals, and members of law enforcement, among others.{{cite news|title=Obama to visit Charleston Wednesday|url=http://www.register-herald.com/news/obama-to-visit-charleston-wednesday/article_94282d58-bf9d-5c85-b421-0b8df16e37b9.html|accessdate=October 17, 2015|publisher=[[The Register-Herald]]|date=October 16, 2015}} West Virginia has the highest rate of [[drug overdose]]-related deaths in the United States.{{cite news|last1=Edwards|first1=Julia|title=Obama targets nation's heroin problem in West Virginia trip|url=https://news.yahoo.com/obama-target-nations-heroin-problem-west-virginia-trip-160738570.html|accessdate=October 23, 2015|work=[[Yahoo! News]]|agency=[[Reuters]]|publisher=[[Yahoo!]]|date=October 21, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Illinois}} ''[[Illinois]]'' |[[Chicago]] |October 27–28 |President Obama attended the [[International Association of Chiefs of Police]] (IACP) conference at [[McCormick Place]], addressing the issue of gun violence, gun control legislation, as well as [[criminal justice reform]].{{cite news|title=Obama to address police chiefs in Chicago today|url=http://wgntv.com/2015/10/27/obama-to-address-police-chiefs-in-chicago-today/|accessdate=October 27, 2015|publisher=[[WGN-TV]]|date=October 27, 2015}} Obama spoke at the IACP conference, attended two political fund raisers, and watched the [[Chicago Bulls]] play the [[Cleveland Cavaliers]] at the [[United Center]].{{cite news|title=Obama tries to walk tightrope on policing in Chicago speech|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/local/breaking/ct-barack-obama-chicago-visit-met-20151027-story.html|accessdate=October 28, 2015|publisher=[[Chicago Tribune]]|date=October 27, 2015}} |} ==November and December== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|New Jersey}} ''[[New Jersey]]''
{{flagicon|New York}} ''[[New York (state)|New York]]'' |[[Newark, New Jersey|Newark]],
[[New York City]] |November 2 |President Obama traveled to New Jersey to address [[criminal justice reform]], where he held a round table discussion and gave a speech at [[Rutgers University-Newark|Rutgers University campus in Newark]].{{cite news|title=How Rutgers-Newark landed a (last-minute) visit from President Obama |url= http://www.nj.com/education/2015/11/obama_in_newark_how_rutgers_landed_a_last-minute_p.html |accessdate=November 6, 2015 |work=[[NJ.com]] |date=November 1, 2015}} He was accompanied during part of the trip by US Senator [[Cory Booker]], and Newark Mayor [[Ras Baraka]].{{cite news|title=Obama To Visit Newark To Speak On Criminal Justice Reform|url=http://newyork.cbslocal.com/2015/10/27/obama-to-visit-newark-to-speak-on-criminal-justice-reform/|accessdate=October 28, 2015|work=[[CBS Local Media]]|publisher=[[CBS News]]|date=October 27, 2015}} Obama made a visit to Integrity House, a [[halfway house]] in Newark, meeting with ex-offenders in the home who are undergoing [[substance abuse]] rehabilitation and job training.{{cite news|title=Obama to visit New Jersey today|url=http://www.app.com/story/news/politics/2015/10/31/obama-visit-new-jersey-monday/74948132/|accessdate=November 3, 2015|work=[[Asbury Park Press]]|publisher=app.com|date=November 2, 2015}} President Obama also traveled to New York City, to attend fundraisers for the [[Democratic National Committee]] and the [[Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee]].{{cite news|title=5 things you need to know about Obama's trip to Newark|url=http://www.nj.com/politics/index.ssf/2015/11/5_things_to_know_about_obamas_trip_to_newark.html|accessdate=November 2, 2015|work=[[NJ.com]]|publisher=NJ.com|date=November 2, 2015}} While in [[Manhattan]], Obama attended a showing of the [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] musical ''[[Hamilton (musical)|Hamilton]]''.{{cite news |title=Obama rips into 2016 GOP field, mocks their debate complaints |url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/11/02/politics/obama-republicans-cnbc/index.html |accessdate=November 3, 2015|work=[[CNN]] |publisher=CNN |date=November 2, 2015}} Obama then returned to New Jersey before traveling back to the [[White House]]. |- |{{flagicon|TUR}} [[Turkey]] |[[Antalya]] |November 14–17 |President Obama attended the [[2015 G-20 Antalya summit|G-20 summit meeting]] in [[Antalya]], where topics such as [[investment strategy]], [[climate change]], [[financial regulation]], [[Political corruption#Opposing corruption|anti-corruption]], and issues on trade and energy were discussed in an effort to strengthen the [[global economy]] and cooperation.{{cite news|last1=Boyer|first1=Dave|title=Obama to visit Turkey, Philippines, Malaysia in November|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2015/oct/26/obama-visit-turkey-philippines-malaysia-november/|accessdate=October 27, 2015|work=[[The Washington Times]]|date=October 26, 2015}} According to [[National Security Advisor (United States)|National Security Advisor]] [[Susan Rice]], President Obama also discussed "[[Computer security|cybersecurity]], [[refugee]]s, [[global health]] security, and [[counter-terrorism]]" during the summit.{{cite news|title=Abe to tout economic measures at G-20 talks|url=http://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2015/11/13/business/abe-tout-economic-measures-g-20-talks/#.VkdYl98rLeQ|accessdate=November 14, 2015|work=[[The Japan Times]]|agency=[[Kyodo News]]|date=November 13, 2015}} He also met with [[President of Turkey|Turkish President]] [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]] (to discuss efforts in managing the [[Syria–Turkey border]], amidst the [[Refugees of the Syrian Civil War|Syrian Civil War refugee crisis]]) and [[Salman of Saudi Arabia|King Salman]] of Saudi Arabia.{{cite news|title=Obama to meet with leaders of Turkey, Canada: White House|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/11/12/us-g20-turkey-obama-idUSKCN0T129J20151112#WbL7hdyWp6Ie7rt6.97|accessdate=November 14, 2015|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=November 12, 2015}}{{cite official|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/991867/obama-in-turkey-for-summit-overshadowed-by-paris-attacks/|accessdate=November 15, 2015|work=[[The Express Tribune]]|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=November 15, 2015}}{{cite news|author1=[[Lynn Sweet|Sweet, Lynn]]|title=Obama guidance, press schedule Nov. 14, 15, 2015. To Turkey for G20|url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/news/7/71/1100896/obama-guidance-press-schedule-nov-14-15-2015-turkey-g20|accessdate=November 14, 2015|work=[[Chicago Sun-Times]]|date=November 14, 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151114210939/http://chicago.suntimes.com/news/7/71/1100896/obama-guidance-press-schedule-nov-14-15-2015-turkey-g20|archivedate=November 14, 2015|df=}} Additionally, President Obama met with [[President of Russia|Russian President]] [[Vladimir Putin]] in a 30-minute meeting to discuss efforts in tackling the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]] and other terrorist groups and resolving the [[Syrian Civil War]], amidst disagreements with the United States regarding [[Russian military intervention in the Syrian Civil War|Russia's military intervention]].{{cite news|author1=[[Peter Baker (author)|Baker, Peter]]|author2=Shear, Michael D.|title=Supporting France, Obama Loath to Add Troops to ISIS Fight|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/11/16/world/europe/obama-g20-turkey.html|accessdate=November 16, 2015|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=November 15, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Hope|first1=Christopher|title=David Cameron and Barack Obama use G20 summit to urge Vladimir Putin to back them over Isil|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/islamic-state/11997551/Cameron-and-Obama-urge-Putin-to-back-them-over-Isil.html|accessdate=November 16, 2015|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=November 16, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|PHI}} [[Philippines]] |[[Manila]],
[[Pasay]] |November 17–20 |President Obama attended the [[APEC Philippines 2015|APEC Economic Leaders' Meeting]] in [[Manila]], focusing on [[inclusive growth]]. On the sidelines of the summit in Manila, he held bilateral meetings with [[President of the Philippines|Philippine President]] [[Benigno Aquino III]], [[Prime Minister of Japan|Japanese Prime Minister]] [[Shinzō Abe]] and newly elected prime ministers [[Malcolm Turnbull]] of Australia and [[Justin Trudeau]] of Canada,{{cite news|title=Obama, Abe to meet in Philippines on Nov. 19 on APEC fringes|url=http://asia.nikkei.com/Politics-Economy/International-Relations/Obama-Abe-to-meet-in-Philippines-on-Nov.-19-on-APEC-fringes|accessdate=November 14, 2015|work=[[The Nikkei]]|date=November 13, 2015}}{{cite news|title=Obama to meet Turnbull in Manila|url=http://www.businessspectator.com.au/news/2015/11/13/international-news/obama-meet-turnbull-manila|accessdate=November 14, 2015|work=[[Business Spectator]]|publisher=[[News Corp Australia]]|date=November 13, 2015}} as well as meetings with [[Trans-Pacific Partnership]] and [[Pacific Alliance]] leaders.{{cite news|last1=Young|first1=Audrey|title=APEC summit: Obama backs Trans Pacific Partnership|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=11547492|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[The New Zealand Herald]]|date=November 19, 2015}} President Obama also delivered remarks at a [[Philippine Navy]] coastal facility by [[Manila Bay]], where he also toured the [[BRP Gregorio del Pilar (PF-15)|BRP ''Gregorio del Pilar'' (PF-15)]], to highlight the United States' commitment to assist in maritime security in the region, amidst the [[Territorial disputes in the South China Sea|territorial disputes]] in the [[South China Sea]].{{cite news|title=Sea rows ‘central issue’ in Obama Asia visit |url=http://www.manilatimes.net/breaking_news/sea-rows-central-issue-in-obama-asia-visit/ |accessdate=November 14, 2015 |work=[[The Manila Times]] |agency=[[Agence France-Presse]] |date=November 13, 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151116130500/http://www.manilatimes.net/breaking_news/sea-rows-central-issue-in-obama-asia-visit/ |archivedate=November 16, 2015 |df= }} During his speech in front of the Philippine Navy, President Obama announced that the [[Federal government of the United States|U.S. government]] will donate the [[research vessel]] [[RV Melville|RV ''Melville'']] and two [[Hamilton-class cutter|''Hamilton''-class cutters]] to the Philippine Navy, one of which will be the [[USCGC Boutwell (WHEC-719)|USCGC ''Boutwell'' (WHEC-719)]].{{cite news|title=PH to get 3rd Hamilton-class warship from US|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/113195-philippine-navy-get-boutwell-cutter|accessdate=November 18, 2015|work=[[Rappler]]|date=November 18, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Gagalac|first1=Ron|title=Obama: US to give 2 more ships to PH|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/11/17/15/obama-us-to-give-2-more-ships-to-ph|accessdate=November 17, 2015|work=[[ABS-CBNnews.com]]|publisher=[[ABS-CBN Corporation]]|date=November 17, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Cahiles|first1=Gerg|title=Obama: U.S. to transfer two vessels to Philippine Navy|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2015/11/17/Obama-U.S.-to-transfer-two-vessels-to-PH-navy.html|accessdate=November 17, 2015|work=[[CNN Philippines]]|date=November 17, 2015}} He later participated at the [[APEC Philippines 2015#CEO Summit|APEC 2015 CEO Summit]], where he met with [[Alibaba Group|Alibaba]] founder and executive chairman [[Jack Ma]] and [[SALt lamp]] inventor Aisa Mijeno and urged business executives to combat [[climate change]].{{cite news|author1=[[Alvin Elchico|Elchico, Alvin]]|title=White House invited Pinay scientist to APEC CEO Summit|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/11/19/15/white-house-invited-pinay-scientist-to-apec-ceo-summit|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[ABS-CBNnews.com]]|publisher=[[ABS-CBN Corporation]]|date=November 20, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Nelson|first1=Colleen McCain|title=Obama Urges CEOs to Fight Climate Change at APEC Summit|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/obama-urges-ceos-to-fight-climate-change-at-apec-summit-1447821870|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[The Wall Street Journal]]|date=November 17, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|MAS}} [[Malaysia]] |[[Kuala Lumpur]] |November 20–22 |President Obama attended the [[Tenth East Asia Summit]] in [[Kuala Lumpur]], which focused on [[Military intervention against ISIL|military intervention]] against the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]] and the [[Territorial disputes in the South China Sea|territorial disputes]] in the [[South China Sea]].{{cite news|last1=Menon|first1=Praveen|last2=Spetalnick|first2=Matt|title=Obama says summit to focus on Islamic State militancy|url=https://news.yahoo.com/security-tightened-malaysia-ahead-obama-arrival-summit-022230391.html|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[Yahoo! News]]|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=November 20, 2015}} On the sidelines of the summit in Kuala Lumpur, the President met with refugees, many of which were [[2015 Rohingya refugee crisis|Rohingya refugees]], at the [http://www.dignityforchildren.org/ Dignity for Children Foundation] refugee center to urge the acceptance of [[Refugees of the Syrian Civil War|Syrian refugees]] into the United States,{{cite news|last1=Memoli|first1=Michael A.|title=At refugee center in Malaysia, Obama calls on U.S. to welcome the 'forgotten'|url=http://www.latimes.com/world/asia/la-fg-obama-malaysia-refugee-center-20151121-story.html|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=November 21, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Spetalnick|first1=Matt|title=Obama visits refugees in Malaysia to highlight global crisis|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/11/21/us-obama-refugees-idUSKCN0TA09Q20151121#lM0oDxoAAzmEa1LW.97|accessdate=November 22, 2015|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=November 21, 2015}}{{cite news|title=US President Obama draws attention to Rohingya refugees in Malaysia|url=http://www.dailysabah.com/americas/2015/11/21/us-president-obama-draws-attention-to-rohingya-refugees-in-malaysia|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[Daily Sabah]]|agency=[[Deutsche Presse-Agentur]]|date=November 21, 2015}} participated in the Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative (YSEALI) town hall at [[Taylor's University]] where he urged the Southeast Asian youth to fight against discrimination,{{cite news|last1=Au|first1=Eunice|title=Obama holds dialogue with Asean youth|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/asia/se-asia/obama-holds-dialogue-with-asean-youth|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[The Straits Times]]|date=November 21, 2015}} and met with Malaysian [[civil society]] groups at a round table meeting at the [[Ritz-Carlton Kuala Lumpur]].{{cite news|title=Obama meets Malaysian civil society groups|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/News/Nation/2015/11/21/Obama-meets-civil-society-groups/|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|date=November 21, 2015}} He also participated in a meeting with leaders of the [[Association of Southeast Asian Nations|ASEAN]] Summit, as well as separate meetings with [[Prime Minister of Laos|Lao Prime Minister]] [[Thongsing Thammavong]] and [[Prime Minister of Singapore|Singaporean Prime Minister]] [[Lee Hsien Loong]]. |- |{{flagicon|FRA}} [[France]] |[[Paris]] |November 29 – December 1 |President Obama participated in the [[2015 United Nations Climate Change Conference]].{{cite news|last1=Cama|first1=Timothy|title=Obama to visit climate pact talks in Paris|url=http://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/259556-obama-to-visit-climate-pact-talks-in-paris|accessdate=November 15, 2015|work=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]]|date=November 9, 2015}} On the sidelines of the conference, he joined [[President of France|President]] [[François Hollande]] and [[List of mayors of Paris|Paris Mayor]] [[Anne Hidalgo]] in paying respects to the victims of the [[November 2015 Paris attacks|Paris attacks]] by laying flowers in front of the [[Bataclan (theatre)|Bataclan]].{{cite news|title=Obama, Hollande pay respects to Paris attack victims|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/obama-hollande-pay-respects-to-paris-attack-victims/|accessdate=November 30, 2015|work=[[The Times of Israel]]|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|date=November 30, 2015}} Obama held separate bilateral meetings with [[President of the People's Republic of China|Chinese President]] [[Xi Jinping]] and [[Prime Minister of India|Indian Prime Minister]] [[Narendra Modi]] to "send a strong message to the world about their strong commitment to climate change," being three of the [[List of countries by carbon dioxide emissions|world's largest carbon dioxide emitters]].{{cite news|last1=Iyengar|first1=Rishi|title=President Obama Will Meet China’s Xi Jinping and India’s Narendra Modi at the Paris Climate Talks|url=http://time.com/4126723/obama-xi-modi-paris-climate-talks/|accessdate=November 26, 2015|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=November 24, 2015}} Obama also met with [[President of Turkey|Turkish President]] [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]] to discuss their [[Military intervention against ISIL|intervention]] against [[ISIL]], as well as to urge the reduction of tensions between Turkey and Russia following the [[2015 Russian Sukhoi Su-24 shootdown|Russian Sukhoi Su-24 shootdown]] by the [[Turkish Air Force]].{{cite news|last1=Mason|first1=Jeff|title=Obama urges Turkey to reduce tensions with Russia|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/12/01/us-mideast-crisis-obama-turkey-idUSKBN0TK3YP20151201#8OSQoXMVGPmuTCqb.97|accessdate=December 2, 2015|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=December 1, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|California}} ''[[California]]'' |[[San Bernardino, California|San Bernardino]] |December 18 |While en route to [[Honolulu]] for the First Family's Christmas vacation, President Obama stopped by San Bernardino, California to meet privately with the families of the victims of the [[2015 San Bernardino attack|San Bernardino attack]].{{cite news|title=Obama to meet families of San Bernardino victims|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/1011514/obama-to-meet-families-of-san-bernardino-victims/|accessdate=December 18, 2015|work=[[The Express Tribune]]|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|date=December 17, 2015}} |} ==References== {{Reflist|35em}} {{Barack Obama}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Presidential Trips Made By Barack Obama during 2015}} [[Category:2015 in international relations]] [[Category:2015 in the United States]] [[Category:2015-related lists]] [[Category:Geography-related lists]] [[Category:Lists of events in the United States]] [[Category:Presidential travels of Barack Obama]]

page.title: List of presidential trips made by Christian Wulff

revision.comment: Moving from [[Category:Diplomatic visits by heads of state]] to [[Category:Lists of diplomatic visits by heads of state]] using [[c:Help:Cat-a-lot|Cat-a-lot]]
revision.text:
{{refimprove|date=November 2013}} This is a list of presidential visits to foreign countries made by '''[[Christian Wulff]]''' as [[President of Germany]]. Wulff held the office from his election on 2 July 2010 until his resignation on 17 February 2012. ==2010== {| class="wikitable" border="1" ! Date ! Country ! Places visited ! Purpose |- |7–8 July 2010 |{{flag|France}}
{{flag|Belgium}} |[[Strasbourg]]
[[Paris]]
[[Brussels]] |Inaugural visits to France, Belgium, and the institutions of [[European Union]] and [[NATO]]: Wulff was formally received by French President [[Nicolas Sarkozy]] at the [[Élysée Palace]] and met with President of the European Parliament [[Jerzy Buzek]], President of the European Commission [[José Manuel Barroso]], President of the European Council [[Herman Van Rompuy]], Secretary General of NATO [[Anders Fogh Rasmussen]] as well as [[Yves Leterme]], the Prime Minister of Belgium and President of the [[European Council]]. |- |10–11 July 2010 |{{flag|South Africa}} |[[Port Elizabeth]]
[[Johannesburg]] |Wulff met with President [[Jacob Zuma]] and watched the third-place play-off of [[2010 FIFA World Cup]], which was contested between the national teams of Uruguay and Germany, as well as [[2010 FIFA World Cup Final|the final]] between the Netherlands and Spain. |- |13–14 July 2010 |{{flag|Poland}}
{{flag|Austria}}
{{flag|Italy}} |[[Warsaw]]
[[Vienna]]
[[Rome]] |Inaugural visits to [[Bronisław Komorowski]], [[Heinz Fischer]] and [[Giorgio Napolitano]], the Presidents of Poland, Austria and Italy, respectively. Wulff also met with Prime Ministers [[Donald Tusk]] (of Poland) and [[Silvio Berlusconi]] (of Italy). |- |28 September 2010 |{{flag|Estonia}} |[[Tallinn]] |Inaugural visit to President [[Toomas Hendrik Ilves]], which also included a talk with Prime Minister [[Andrus Ansip]]. |- |{{nowrap|11–15 October 2010}} |{{flag|Russia}} |[[Moscow]]
[[Tver]]
[[Saint Petersburg]]
[[Ulyanovsk]] |During his first [[state visit]], Christian Wulff met with President [[Dmitry Medvedev]] and Prime Minister [[Vladimir Putin]] and held a speech about the [[Germany–Russia relations|relationship between Germany and Russia]] at the [[National Research University – Higher School of Economics|Higher School of Economics]]. |- |18–22 October 2010 |{{flag|Turkey}} |[[Ankara]]
[[Kayseri]]
[[Tarsus, Mersin|Tarsus]]
[[Istanbul]] |After having been formally received by President [[Abdullah Gül]] and a meeting with Prime Minister [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]], Wulff addressed the [[Grand National Assembly of Turkey]], being the first German head of state to be granted this honour. He attended a church service at Tarsus with members of five [[Christian denomination]]s as well as the groundbreaking ceremony for the ''Türk-Alman Üniversitesi'', a Turkish-German university in Istanbul. |- |12 November 2010 |{{flag|Luxembourg}} |[[Luxembourg (city)|Luxembourg]] |Inaugural visit to Grand Duke [[Henri, Grand Duke of Luxembourg|Henri]]; Wulff also met with Prime Minister [[Jean-Claude Juncker]]. |- |18 November 2010 |{{flag|Netherlands}} |[[The Hague]] |Inaugural visit to [[Beatrix of the Netherlands|Queen Beatrix]]; Wulff also met with Prime Minister [[Mark Rutte]]. |- |22 November 2010 |{{nowrap|{{flag|Czech Republic}}}} |[[Prague]] |Completing a series of inaugural visits, Wulff was received by President [[Václav Klaus]] and met with Prime Minister [[Petr Nečas]]. |- |{{nowrap|27–30 November 2010}} |{{flag|Israel}}
{{flag|West Bank}} |[[Jerusalem]]
[[Beit Jala]]
[[Bethlehem]] |Wulff was received by President [[Shimon Peres]] and had talks with Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]], Foreign Minister [[Avigdor Lieberman]] and opposition leader [[Tzipi Livni]], as well as [[Palestinian people|Palestinian]] politician [[Mahmoud Abbas]]. He visited the [[Yad Vashem]] holocaust memorial and the [[Church of the Nativity]]. |- |7 December 2010 |{{flag|Poland}} |[[Warsaw]] |Wulff attended a ceremony commemorating the 40th anniversary of [[Willy Brandt]]'s ''[[Warschauer Kniefall|Kniefall von Warschau]]'' hosted by President [[Bronisław Komorowski]] and visited the [[Monument to the Ghetto Heroes]]. |- |} ==2011== {| class="wikitable" border="1" ! Date ! Country ! Places visited ! Purpose |- |27 January 2011 |{{flag|Poland}} |[[Oświęcim]] |Wulff delivered a speech at the ceremony commemorating the 66th anniversary of the liberation of the [[Auschwitz concentration camp]]. |- |10 February 2011 |{{flag|Spain}}
{{flag|Portugal}} |[[Madrid]]
[[Lisbon]] |Wulff was received by King [[Juan Carlos I of Spain]] and met with Prime Minister [[José Luis Rodríguez Zapatero]]. In Portugal, he met with President [[Aníbal Cavaco Silva]], Prime Minister [[José Sócrates]] and the President of the [[Assembly of the Republic (Portugal)|Assembly of the Republic]], [[Jaime Gama]]. |- |26–28 February 2011 |{{flag|Kuwait}}
{{flag|Qatar}} |[[Kuwait City]]
[[Doha]] |The German President attended a meeting for several heads of states, which was organized by [[Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah]], the Emir of Kuwait, on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the independence from the United Kingdom, as well as the 20th anniversary of [[Liberation of Kuwait campaign|the liberation]] from Iraqi troops. Wulff also met with the Emir of Qatar [[Hamad bin Khalifa Al Thani]] and delivered a speech at [[Qatar University]]. |- |8–9 April 2011 |{{flag|Hungary}} |[[Budapest]] |Wulff attended the 2011 [[Arraiolos meeting]] of non-executive presidents of European Union member states, where he gave a speech "On [[Multiculturalism]] and the European Identity". |- |{{nowrap|30 April–7 May 2011}} |{{flag|Mexico}}
{{flag|Costa Rica}}
{{flag|Brazil}} |[[Teotihuacan]]
[[Mexico City]]
[[Guanajuato, Guanajuato|Guanajuato]]
[[San José, Costa Rica|San José]]
[[Brasilia]]
[[São Paulo]] |Latin America tour, during which Christian Wulff was formally received by [[Felipe Calderón]], [[Laura Chinchilla]] and [[Dilma Rousseff]], the respective Presidents of Mexico, Costa Rica and Brazil. Further appointments included visits to the pre-Hispanic city of Teotihuacan, the [[International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center]] and the [[National Autonomous University of Mexico]]. Wulff also attended a ceremony celebrating the completion of the renovation of the [[National Theatre of Costa Rica]] and visited [[Braulio Carrillo National Park]]. |- |5–6 July 2011 |{{flag|South Africa}} |[[Durban]] |During the [[123rd IOC Session]], Wulff lobbied for [[Bids for the 2018 Winter Olympics#Munich|Munich's bid]] for the [[2018 Winter Olympics]]. |- |7–8 July 2011 |{{flag|Italy}} |[[Rome]]
[[Lake Como]] |Wulff was received by President [[Giorgio Napolitano]] and attended the festivities commemorating the 150th anniversary of the [[Italian unification]]. He further visited ''Villa Vigoni'', a German-Italian center for cultural exchange. |- |8–9 September 2011 |{{flag|Poland}} |[[Kraków]] |Wulff was received by President [[Bronisław Komorowski]] at the historic [[Kraków Old Town|old town of Kraków]] on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the [[German–Polish Border Treaty (1990)|German-Polish Border Treaty]]. |- |26 September 2011 |{{flag|Liechtenstein}} |[[Vaduz]] |Wulff attended the annual informal meeting of the German speaking heads of state, together with President of Austria [[Heinz Fischer]], President of the Swiss Federation [[Micheline Calmy-Rey]] and Crown Prince [[Alois, Hereditary Prince of Liechtenstein|Alois of Liechtenstein]]. |- |26–27 September 2011 |{{flag|Slovakia}} |[[Bratislava]]
[[Kežmarok]] |Wulff was received by President [[Ivan Gašparovič]] and met with Prime Minister [[Iveta Radičová]] and Speaker of the Parliament [[Richard Sulík]]. He opened an exhibition about the history of the [[Carpathian Germans]]. |- |16–17 October 2011 |{{flag|Afghanistan}} |[[Kabul]]
[[Mazar-i-Sharif]]
[[Kunduz]] |In Kabul, Wulff was received by President [[Hamid Karzai]] and delivered a speech on human rights at the German embassy. He paid visits to [[Bundeswehr]] forces at [[Camp Marmal]], a training center for Afghan police forces and met with humanitarian workers and soldiers in Kunduz. |- |23–28 October 2011 |{{flag|Japan}} |[[Tokyo]]
[[Fukushima Prefecture|Fukushima]]
[[Yokkaichi, Mie|Yokkaichi]]
[[Naruto, Tokushima|Naruto]] |State visit on occasion of the 150th anniversary of bilateral [[Germany–Japan relations]], during which the German President was accompanied by a delegation of German trade representatives and businesspeople: Wulff met with Emperor [[Akihito]], Crown Prince [[Crown Prince Naruhito|Naruhito]] and Prime Minister [[Yoshihiko Noda]]. He gave a speech "On the Responsibilities of Technical Advancement" at the [[University of Tsukuba]] and visited the area affected by the [[2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami]] as well as the former [[Bandō prisoner-of-war camp]]. |- |14 November 2011 |{{flag|Poland}} |[[Wrocław]] |Wulff attended a commemorative act celebrating the 200th anniversary of the [[University of Wrocław]], together with President of Poland [[Bronisław Komorowski]] and President of Ukraine [[Viktor Yanukovych]]. |- |{{nowrap|28 November–2 December 2011}} |{{flag|Bangladesh}}
{{flag|Indonesia}} |[[Dhaka]]
[[Jakarta]] |During these state visits, Wulff was formally received by President of Bangladesh [[Zillur Rahman]] and later by President of Indonesia [[Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono]]. He met further politicians of the respective countries, including Prime Minister of Bangladesh [[Sheikh Hasina]], Foreign Minister [[Dipu Moni]] and [[Association of Southeast Asian Nations|ASEAN]] Secretary General [[Surin Pitsuwan]]. Places visited include the [[Jatiyo Smriti Soudho]] memorial and [[Istiqlal Mosque, Jakarta]]. Wulff delivered speeches at [[University of Dhaka]] and [[University of Indonesia]]. |- |8–13 December 2011 |{{flag|Oman}}
{{flag|Qatar}}
{{nowrap|{{flag|United Arab Emirates}}}}
{{flag|Kuwait}} |[[Muscat, Oman|Muscat]]
[[Nizwa]]
[[Doha]]
[[Abu Dhabi]]
[[Kuwait City]] |Touring the countries of the Arab peninsula, Wulff was received by the respective heads of state Sultan of Oman [[Qaboos bin Said al Said]], the Emir of Qatar [[Hamad bin Khalifa Al Thani]], the President of the United Arab Emirates [[Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan]] and the Emir of Kuwait, [[Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah]]. Places visited include the [[Sultan Qaboos Grand Mosque]], the [[German University of Technology in Oman]], [[Zayed University]], [[Sheikh Zayed Mosque]] and [[Masdar City]]. Among other appointments, Wulff attended the opening of the 4th ''Forum of the [[Alliance of Civilizations]]''. On 12 December, being "on the way to the Emir", Wulff made a controversial call to [[Kai Diekmann]], the chief editor of ''[[Bild]]'' that sparked the ''[[Causa Wulff]]'', which would ultimately lead to the resignation of the President. |- |23 December 2011 |{{flag|Czech Republic}} |[[Prague]] |State funeral of [[Václav Havel]]. |- |} ==2012== {| class="wikitable" border="1" ! Date ! Country ! Places visited ! Purpose |- |nowrap|10–11 February 2012 |{{nowrap|{{flag|Finland}}}} |[[Helsinki]] |Wulff attended the 2012 [[Arraiolos meeting]] of non-executive presidents of European Union member states, hosted by Finnish President-elect [[Sauli Niinistö]]. |- |{{nowrap|13–15 February 2012}} |{{flag|Italy}} |[[Rome]]
[[Milan]]
[[Bari]] |State visit on invitation of President [[Giorgio Napolitano]], which put a focus on the economic relations between the two countries. |- |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.bundespraesident.de/DE/Die-Bundespraesidenten/Christian-Wulff/Reisen-und-Termine/reisen-und-termine-node.html Official website about the appointments and journeys of President Wulff] {{DEFAULTSORT:Wulff Christian trips}} [[Category:Lists of diplomatic visits by heads of state]] [[Category:Geography-related lists]] [[Category:Political history of Germany]] [[Category:State visits by German presidents]] [[Category:Christian Wulff|*]]

revision.comment: Importing Wikidata [[Wikipedia:Short description|short description]]: "Wikimedia list article" ([[User:Galobtter/Shortdesc helper|Shortdesc helper]])
Check/ Tidy refs
revision.text:
{{wiktionary|tump}} {{Confuse|TuMP}} {{redirect|Tump|}} '''Tump''' means a hillock, mound, barrow or tumulus. The Welsh words ''twmp'' and ''Twmpath'' may be related. Although some may appear similar to glacial [[drumlins]], for the most part they are man-made, e.g. remains from mineral extraction, burial mounds [[tumulus|(tumuli]] and especially [[Bowl barrow#Tump|bowl barrows]]) or [[motte-and-bailey castle]] mounds. The following geographical features in the UK are referred to using the word:
*[[Almondsbury#Description|Almondsbury Tump]]: a slight prominence near the top of the scarp, in open space near the Swan, Almondsbury, South Gloucestershire *[[Leafield#History|Barry's Hill Tump]]: a barrow in the civil parish of Leafield, Oxfordshire<ref>[http://historicoxfordshire.ashmolean.org/SitePages/leafield.html Site Name: Leafield ''Leafield Barrow... Locally it is known as 'Barry's Hill Tump' or 'Barry's Tump' ''] ''historicoxfordshire.ashmolean.org'', accessed 22 October 2018</ref> *[[Gilwern|Battle Tump]]:<ref>[http://www.llanellycc.org.uk/documents/GilwernPart2.pdf Document at llanellycc.org.uk about Gilwern], accessed 22 October 2018</ref> a castle motte, Scheduled Ancient Monument, Lower Common, Gilwern, Monmouthshire *[[Bettws Newydd#History|Bettws Newydd]] tump: an early Norman motte-and-bailey tump in Monmouthshire *[[Bledisloe Tump]]: a castle in Awre, Gloucestershire *[[Brinklow Castle]] known locally as 'the Tump': a medieval castle in the village of Brinklow, Warwickshire *[[King's Caple#Buildings|Caple Tump]]: an earthwork reputed to be the remains of a castle motte in King's Caple, Herefordshire *[[Castle Tump]]: an early 11th-century motte-and-bailey castle in Trecastle, Powys *[[List of Roman villas in Wales|Castle Tump, Caerwent]]: site of a Roman villa in Monmouthshire *[[Castle Tump, Dymock]]: a castle in Dymock, Gloucestershire *[[Glasbury#History|Castle Tump Motte (see Glasbury Castle)]], Glasbury, Powys *[[Tenbury Wells#History|Castle Tump, Tenbury Wells]]: believed to be the remains of an early Norman motte-and-bailey castle near Burford, Shropshire and Tenbury Wells, Worcestershire *[[Congrove Field and The Tumps]]: north of Bath (Bath and North East Somerset), possibly the site of mining activities in the past *[[Beguildy#Beguildy Castle|Crugyn Tump]]: castle mound/motte, Beguildy, Powys *East Tump and West Tump: small (ca. 50m and 100m long respectively) tidal islands off the respective coasts of the Island of [[Grassholm]] *[[Edmunds Tump]]: a hill near Grosmont in north-eastern Monmouthshire *[[Hetty Pegler's Tump]]: a Neolithic burial mound near the village of Uley, Gloucestershire *[[Knucklas#Historic Knucklas|Knucklas Castle Mound]]: site of a castle near the battlefield of the Battle of Beguildy, Powys *[[Leigh, Worcestershire#History|Leigh Castle Tump]]: earthwork and buried remains of a medieval motte-and-bailey castle at Castle Green near Leigh, Worcestershire *[[Hatterrall Ridge|Loxidge Tump cairn]]: round cairn on the Offa's Dyke Path, Hatterrall Ridge, with Llanthony to one side and Llanveynoe the other; there are several other cairns nearby in general vicinity of Llanvihangel Crucorney *[[Keynsham Humpy Tumps]]: site of open patches of grassland and bare rock, interspersed with blocks of scrub, alongside the Bristol to Bath railway line *[[Maes Tump]]: an Iron Age hillfort in Somerset *[[Tonteg#Castle|Monkey Tump]]: 12th-century motte castle in Tonteg, Rhondda Cynon Taf *[[Oldbury-on-the-Hill#History|Nan Tow's Tump]]: a round barrow by the A46 near Oldbury-on-the-Hill, Gloucestershire *[[Bacton, Herefordshire|Newcourt Tump]]: earthwork remains of a small motte-and-bailey castle 1 milenorth of Bacton, Herefordshire *[[Clifford, Herefordshire|Newton Tump]]: remains of a motte-and-bailey castle 3 miles southeast of Clifford, Herefordshire *[[Cheshire#History|Robin Hood's Tump (see under 'Buildings and structures')]]: prehistoric burial ground near Alpraham, Cheshire *[[St Weonards#St Weonards Tump|St Weonards Tump]]: immediately south of St Weonards churchyard, Herefordshire *[[Slwch Tump]]: an Iron Age hill fort close to Brecon, Powys *[[Stow Green, St Briavels|Stow Green Tump]], also known as Castle Tump: remains of a castle near the village of St Briavels, Gloucestershire *[[History of Wiltshire#Ancient moot places and meeting points|Swanborough Tump]]: a hillock in the parish of Manningford Abbots, Wiltshire, identified as the moot-place mentioned in the will of King Alfred *[[Table Hill]] tump: in the Malvern Hills between North Hill and Sugarloaf Hill (Herefordshire–Worcestershire border) *[[Taplow burial|Tappa's Tump]]<ref>[https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Tappa%27s_Tump Images in commons.wikimedia.org relating to Tappa's Tump], accessed 22 October 2018</ref> or "Tæppa's mound": burial mound near Taplow, Buckinghamshire *"The Tump": ancient burial mound near [[Whittington, Worcestershire]] *Tump Farm, [[Wilcrick]]: a farm near Wilcrick Hill, which was a hillfort in former Monmouthshire *[[Trellech#Places of historical interest|Tump Terret]]: mound marking the site of a small motte-and-bailey castle in Trellech, Monmouthshire *[[Llanwarne#Wesleyan Chapel|Turkey Tump]]: on the ridge immediately north-west of [[Llanwarne]], Herefordshire ({{gbmappingsmall|SO504288}}) *[[Wednesbury#History|Wednesbury Tump (see 'Post-Medieval times')]]: Wednesbury, West Midlands *[[Windmill Tump]]: a Neolithic burial site west of the village of Rodmarton, Gloucestershire *[[Wormelow Tump]]: village in Herefordshire, location of the burial mound of King Arthur's son Amr
